pages.text: These planets are... God knows what they are in reality, but what they seem to be on the otherhand? Purple, festering abominations littered with the shells of whatever creatures used to live here. Although many things here seem all too familiar...

The massive, lumbering husks encountered here resemble the Enderman you're used to fending off on your home high above the surface.$(br)The strange, purple, oversized bugs roaming the surface could easily be mistaken for the equally as oversized spiders that you mindlessly swat with your sword.

The humanoid monstrosities that seem to be little more than a host for some infection resemble the zombies at home, just as mindless, just as deadly.$(br)The strange repitilians are unlike anything you've ever seen. They behave like pigmen but vaguely resemble the Ender Dragon in a sense.

The purple colour itself is reminiscent of the strange, purple 'seeds' of tentacles that appear from those voids in reality that sometimes form from reckless Thaumaturgy.
Could this land be the final consequence of it? If so, where is the perportrator? And is there more than one?

If someone were to survive on this planet for long periods of time, living high up in the clouds, so far up that you can't even see the world below you, seems like the only real option, as the air at the surface is barely breathable.

You've never exactly felt inclined to venture to the surface of your home. And now you think you know why.$(br2)Atleast there's some useful resources down below, the rocks on the otherhand are completely useless.
